subject: Investing
title: Sunk Cost Fallacy in Portfolios
description: A quick, practical guide to Sunk Cost Fallacy in Portfolios.

hook.text: An investor held a stock that fell 60% for three years, saying 'I've already lost so much, I can't sell now.'

buildup.text: The sunk cost fallacy is continuing to invest time or money because of what you've already spent.

discovery.text: Past costs are gone. The only question is: 'Given today's facts, is this the best use of my money?'

twist.text: Selling a loser and buying a winner 'feels' like admitting failure, but it's the rational move.

climax.text: Tax-loss harvesting turns the sunk cost into a tax benefit, making the sell-and-redeploy move even smarter.

punchline.text: Don't throw good money after bad. Cut losses and redeploy.

quiz.question: What is the sunk cost fallacy?
options: Investing more because of past spending already lost
